item.title: Elminage ORIGINAL: Priestess of Darkness and The Ring of the Gods coming to console this summer in Japan
item.content:encoded:
https://www.gematsu.com/2025/02/elminage-original-priestess-of-darkness-and-the-ring-of-the-gods-coming-to-console-this-summer-in-japan

Further details to be announced in late March.

Mebius will release a console version of Elminage ORIGINAL: Priestess of Darkness and The Ring of the Gods this summer in Japan as the first in a series of console ports of the Elminage dungeon RPG series, the publisher announced.

Development of the release will be handled by OperaHouse. Further information, including screenshots and a release date, will be announced in late March.

Elminage ORIGINAL: Priestess of Darkness and The Ring of the Gods is currently available for PC via Steam, where it launched in 2017. It originally released for PlayStation 2 in 2008, and has also been ported to DS, PSP, and 3DS.

item.title: VTuber Momo Mitsuki visual novel Neko Neko Travel Agency: Peachy Town Revitalization Project announced for Switch, PC
item.content:encoded:
https://www.gematsu.com/2025/02/vtuber-momo-mitsuki-visual-novel-neko-neko-travel-agency-peachy-town-revitalization-project-announced-for-switch-pc

  • PC
  • Switch

Due out on May 20.

CyberStep visual novel game brand Rabbitfoot has announced Neko Neko Travel Agency: Peachy Town Revitalization Project, a fully voiced visual novel starring Virtual YouTuber Momo Mitski. It will launch for Switch and PC via Steam and DLsite on May 20 with English, Japanese, Traditional Chinese, Simplified Chinese, and other language support.

Here is the story synopsis:

“Welcome to Neko Neko Tourism!”

Nekomisaki Town is a once-thriving rural town now in decline. After suddenly being transferred to a tourism agency in this town, you meet your senior colleague Momo Mitsuki.

Right after you arrive, both you and Momo Mitsuki are called in by the company president, who assigns you to lead a town revitalization project tied to the fireworks festival scheduled in one month.

In order to bring the town back to life, you and Momo Mitsuki race across the town—from the fishing harbor to the shopping district to the peach farm.

Can the two of you make the “Nekomisaki Town Revitalization Project” a success?
